intro: Leptochilus hilocarpus, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and covered in fine hairs. Leptochilus hilocarpus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in shady, humid environments.
